title: Sarah Ferguson's Emails with Jeffrey Epstein
summary: This article talks about emails that were released involving Sarah Ferguson, who used to be married to Prince Andrew. The emails show she was friends with Jeffrey Epstein, a man who got in trouble for bad things with young people. In the emails, Sarah says nice things about Epstein, calling him a brother she always wanted. She also asks him for money to help pay for things like rent. Her daughters, Beatrice and Eugenie, are mentioned too, which makes them feel embarrassed. The article says there is no proof that Sarah or her daughters did anything wrong, but the emails are still upsetting for them because Epstein was a criminal. It shows how being friends with someone who does bad things can cause problems for other people.

When emails between them are released, it can make people feel embarrassed because Epstein did bad things. This article explains how friendships with criminals can affect others, even if they didn't do anything wrong.
